name: Big Data 4 Giving
tagline: Helping corporations make data-based giving decisions
body:
### Smart Giving
This project aims to provide community-level data to donors and organizations that provide services. Started at ATXHack4Change 2016, we take census data to identify areas of need in our city to allow donors and non-profits to make informed decisions on how their dollars and efforts can impact our community. The initial product focuses on the city of Austin, Texas and census data on poverty. 

Started with low poverty index.

### Backend need-to-know
Weâ€™ve crafted some handsome templates for you to use. Go ahead and click 'Continue to layouts' to browse through them. You can easily go back to edit your page before publishing. After publishing your page, you can revisit the page generator and switch to another theme. Your Page content will be preserved.

Should be familiar with US census bureau and HUD (housing and urban development), make calls and grab data to put it on a map.
HUD arcgis server is a bit difficult to work with compared to other systems, the spatial reference system that they use (esri) is not the same as typical latitude and longitude coordinates. 

Creating a backend to interact with the HUD API directly (7 separate data bases) so that the front-end can more easily retrieve information from a variety of databases.

Still trying to figure out how to convert between esri and wgs84. Looking at using terraformer library.

### Front end need-to-know
Understanding of Leaflet and Javascript to build a front end to visualize the data on the map,
